caption: They had great service and outdoor, safe seating. The food was delicious, well seasoned, and the portion size was perfect for a small meal. It's a bit on the expensive side, but definitely worth a splurge every now and again.
Passionately executed ramen. Everything is made in-house. The warmest and most delicious experience.

One of the best ramen shops i've been too in the country so far. Having been to both Michelin rated shops: Tsuta and Nakiryu in Tokyo, among hundreds of other shops in the Honshu area it was surprising to find something that actually satisfied the old craving. House made noodles make a huge difference and big cuts of pork. The spicy broth was especially good, very likely due to the Korean influence.
Best broth in the business!
Favorite ramen in dc
Best ramen in DC
I love ramen and this has to be the best ramen in area! You will not be disappointed. Great friendly staff and service as well. Slightly pricier than others, but definitely worth it.
Perfect food, amazing service, cool atmosphere.  My favorite place in DC now. Very cool neighborhood 2 other great restaurants on the a same block
The best ramen in the area. We miss their Annapolis Junction pop-up, but their new DC location is very nice and well setup for covid. The takeout was very good as well.
Best ramen in the DMV. The tonkatsu broth is like none other. Get the spicy version! Worth the drive and the wait every time.

Deliciously vivid, deep, and high energy, each bowl reflects the attention to detail and spirit of the team.  The bowls are large and very filling. Two of us are big eaters and we ordered 3: triple threat, spicy tonkotsu, and spicy tantanmen, with an extra egg, chili, ginger, and spring onion. Also, get the Japanese soda, it’s good.  The noodles were perfectly cooked and just right for biting and the broth was so balanced and precise that makes you crave for one more spoon each time. The star of the night was the chashu, which was a thick cut and tasted heavenly! The Menma bamboo shoot tasted different to us in each bowl and it was a refreshing contrast.  Our favorite was the triple threat because of the depth of the broth and the thickness of the noodles. The second favorite was spicy tonkotsu. And while the tantanmen was really good too, we thought that the broth was a bit salty (note that we were the last table to order that night and the broth was properly more dense at that time).  From greeter to server, the service seems consistently good. The dreamy indie pop music was a nice touch but the speaker was a bit not clear enough in the bass.  It was a delight and I really enjoy writing this long review for this place. Love it and I will definitely return when I’m in DC!
They were amazing and kind we came 15 min before closing time and our server Joe treated us as if they had just opened great service great food
Amazing! I couldn't get over how creamy the broth was

They were so nice and mindful with our take out order that we wanted to eat in our vehicle. The food was delicious and service was awesome :) egg was nicely seasoned and the meat was seared and gave it extra texture!
Great Ramen with lots of flavor depth. Takes my wife and I back to some of the best Ramen we had in Kyoto! They really do a great job with their takeout. Looking forward to dining in person.
This is the best ramen I've had in a while. Very authentic and they even make their own noodles!
Really great Ramen shop in the heart of Petworth. The staff is really friendly and get your food to you safely. The Sunset Shoyu is particularly to tasty.

Just ate here for the first time and I'm really impressed. I've tried basically every ramen establishment in DC and I would put this in the top 5 for sure! I tried the spicy Tan Tan, really good consistency in the noodles and the broth had a unique, nutty flavor. Will definitely be back!
Great neighborhood spot! Im so excited to have this shop within walking distance. Perfect for take out and does not disappoint.

This is the best ramen shop in the DMV area, hands down.  They make everything from scratch, even their noodles. Very authentic ramen. A lot of time and effort goes into their food and you can taste it.
Absolutely amazing. Got the Sunset Shoyu and it didn't disappoint at all! Amazing flavor and great customer service! Will be back!
Incredible new ramen restaurant in my Petworth neighborhood. Of course this is during covid so haven't gotten to enjoy it in house but take out didn't disappoint.

Simply the best Ramen I've ever had. Try Spicy Tonkotsu it's amazing. The broth is so flavorful and savory, noodles are excellent and homemade. Pork was to die for!! This is my favorite Ramen in the DMV hands down. A++

Beautiful space and friendly staff. I got the spicy vegan ramen. I thought the egg and the bamboo shoots were super tasty. The noodles were tasty but in terms of firmness, they were a bit too soggy for my taste. I like mine al dente. Lastly is the broth. I was not a fan. It was a little too nutty for me.
Best ramen I have ever had! Must try for any ramen lover!
This is no joke ramen. DC finally had authentic ramen and not chain. This is a must if you’re looking for the best. No-frills. Just awesome

Great ramen with the best bamboo shoots I have ever had Got take out because its Covid and the to-go packaging made it very easy to reheat and eat. I got the Triple threat with extra egg, extra pork. It was great

I was excited to try this shop after hearing positive things from friends. But after trying two bowls, I am left feeling underwhelmed.  The Vegan Classic was pretty well seasoned, and the mouthfeel of the broth felt surprisingly substantial without being too heavy. However, it lacked depth and offered little beyond tasting salty. The Vegan Spicy Tantan Men had a good level of heat to it, but again lacked a depth of flavor in the broth. It was hard to even pick out the taste of the sesame paste. I appreciated the house-made noodles which were thin and stayed chewy in the broth.  By far the most disappointing aspect of each bowl was the toppings. The mushrooms' natural flavors were drowned out by the broth. Despite their considerable size, it felt like they only served as a textural addition to the dishes. Only the nori and pickled ginger cut through the broth to add a welcome burst of additional flavor.  While I truly appreciate ramen shops offering vegan bowls on the menu, they typically feel like an afterthought compared to other bowls. Unfortunately, Menya Hosaki's offerings are no different.
Honestly, the best ramen I've had is here. The staff and the owner treat everyone so well. I'm always satisfied when come here. I'm loyal!
Delicious ramen, friendly staff, cozy outdoors setup with patio heaters

Wonderful Ramen shop! I got the Spicy Vegan dish, and it was amazing! Probably the best Ramen I've ever had in my life, granted I'm used to Top Ramen during my college days 🤣  But definitely stop by and enjoy some super yummy food! おいしいです！

Their Spicy Tonkotsu Ramen was one of the better ramen I've had in DC/Metro area. Their broth tasted very fresh, and was very hearty. I could taste a lot of pork and ginger pickle was helping me with oils. It was well balanced ramen.

Very cute ramen shop in a very cute area! I got the "Triple Threat" and I think it might've been one of the best ramen I've tasted in a really long time. Very rich and flavorful, and the oiliness wasn't overpowering at all (like alot of other ramen places). The heaters outside were a very nice plus especially since it's getting colder. Great service, and really nice people! Can't wait to go back again and try the other ramen options.

Menya Hosaki is one of D.C.'s newest ramen shops. It's a simple, yet elegant little noodle shop along Upshur Street NW in Petworth.  They have nine different ramen noodles on the menu ranging from classic shoyu to spicy ramen to their own creation inspired by dan dan noodles. The prices range from $15 to $18 with additional costs for add-ons.  I ordered the dan dan noodle inspired ramen and it came with a spice kick. I ordered an extra egg and noodles and it was very filling. The bamboo and egg inside the ramen were divine.  My wife and housemate ordered the classic shoyu and were split on it. One loved it and the other thought it didn't stand out.  Do safe pick-up and you can be the judge.
Tried it today for the first time (take out). What a delicious surprise. The broth is tasty, the noodles are perfect, and the pork oh my oh my. Definitely to be repeated.

The "triple threat" was delicious and people were so nice. They are doing a great job managing the crowds by scheduling pick-up windows. It's over an hour after you place the order online on Friday nights, but well worth the wait!

AMAZING!!!!! I've been to countless ramen restaurants all over the DMV and I'm never eating at another Ramen place again. I've tried every option on their menu including the vegan options and have never been disappointed. Menya Hosaki has set the bar so high that no one else can measure up.
Delicious ramen, very clean and just great with covid-19.
Great food, friendly staff. I'm hoping they also get a liquor license
Great service and delicious food!!!

Love the decor/vibe of the shop, love the service and honesty the ramen was not bad either. It was a bit too salty towards the end and the noodles was softer than I expected but overall, a good place!
Fantastic ramen! Staff is super friendly. Will be back for more!
Love it, authentic

I drove 40 minutes to come here because I saw a Tiktok raving about this place and how people need to try it. They were right, this place is amazing. Everything was delicious and had so much flavor. The bamboo shoots were amazing. I got the Spicy Tonkotsu and my boyfriend got the Classic Tonkotsu which was also really good. If you're in the DC area definitely go try this place out!! I will definitely be back.
BEST RAMEN IN DMV AREA BY A MILE!!! KANPAI CHEFS!!! NEW WEEKLY RAMEN-YA! (Across the street from old Himitsu/Pom Pom) Follow me on IG for more at: @justsommfoodie
Best ramen I have had in DC by a strong margin. Comparable, if not better, than many long-standing ramen staples in NYC.  Whatever you guys are doing, keep it up!  I tried classic tonkotsu
So delicious! One of the best tankatsu broths around! Also amazing noodles and good spice levels!

Every other noodle bowl in the city, I’ll let you finish... but Menya may have the best ramen in DC. I know most people in the Petworth area have no clue what Uptown used to be, but it certainly wasn’t traditional ramen shops. Not only is their ramen top tier, but they’ve injected a long missed sense of community into the area. This part of the city has changed drastically but this addition is hugely welcomed. Try the Spicy Tantan, it’s as close to perfect as a bowl of noodles can get!
Excellent ramen with nice outdoor seating area and friendly staff.

Woah, this is legit ramen. Rich flavor, authentic, clean ingredients. Excellent service, chic ambiance. Petworth is lucky to have this as a neighborhood spot. If you don’t live close, it’s worth the drive. ✨✨✨
Thinking about this ramen brings warm memories to my heart. I tried the spicy vegan and will be back to try more!
Perfectly tasty ramen with all the flavors of Japan.

My boyfriend and I were big fans of the pop-up, and were excited for their permanent location to open up. The ramen is delicious!! I’ve never had broth with such a rich flavor, and their noodles are the perfect consistency. We’ll definitely be making stops in the future, it’s the best comfort food!

Got the basics for our first time: Classic shoyu and classic tonkatsu and WOW, so rich and flavorful. Toppings like the chicken and chashu pork were cooked perfectly and the noodles had that fantastic bite to them!  We'll be back for spicy version and the triple threat soon.  Welcome, we're so glad you've come!

Fantastic ramen shop with space inside and outside for seating. The menu is delivering exactly on the promise of Ramen. You have a handful of options, and that's more than enough. Menya Hosaki is crafting their ramen and making everything in-house. I appreciate the page and a half menu, that isn't a 50 option list. They are serving up what they do best. The flavors we're tasty -- complex, not too heavy -- and the portion generous. The pork in the tankatsu was melt in your mouth delicious, and the jammy eggs were amazing. The details and quality all shine through, including in the high end disposable chopsticks which were a nice addition.  From the greeters and the servers, everything was high energy and happy to be open, and we're happy to have them in the neighborhood! Looking forward to coming here again!

We got takeout from here and the broth was delicious and really big portions. Pork belly was cooked perfectly and the right amount of spice. Had a good Order ahead system, will be back!  Perfect for crisp fall weeks when you are just over cooking all week. Will be back!!
Longtime customer of theirs. Love the new space and ramen is amazing as always!

Got takeout from this place on its first night - two bowls of classic Shoyu, one Triple Threat, and one spicy Tonkatsu. All incredibly flavorful and so yummy! We didn't eat inside but it looks really great - look forward to more visits in the future. Thanks for coming to Petworth! What a great addition to Upshur St.
If you are looking for delicious, authentic tonkotsu ramen, you MUST give this place a try.  Actually, drop whatever you’re doing and go try it immediately. It’s that good.

So delicious! The broth was exceptionally flavorful and not heavy/oily (like at so many ramen shops). The noodles were perfectly cooked and the toppings were authentic. Fantastic addition to the neighborhood - can't wait to eat here all the time!
Always a quality experience. Cheers to the staff!
The staff was very friendly, food was incredible, and very safe setup (both inside and outside). Can't wait to return! MUST GO!
The most delicious bowl of ramen I've ever tasted. Quality ingredients, welcoming staff, and a crisp, clean space made for a great dining experience!

Such an amazing ramen place in Petworth! Cute patio and indoor design. The ramen is phenomenal and the owners are great!! A family owned business that focuses on quality ingredients, I had the spicy tonkontsu and it was so flavorful!
Simple & clean interior, food is bomb 😁 broths are so hearty, eating this in the winter would be amazing...but it was dope in the summer too!

Had this back at their first location. It's the best ramen I've had in DC/San Fran/LA (haven't had NY ramen). The classic shoyu is incredible and so is the Baltimore sun. Every ingredient is perfect. Pork is tender, chicken is tender, bamboo shoots are insane, egg is perfect, noodles are on point. If they get the same (or better) ingredients as they did in their original location, this is your new favorite ramen spot.
Absolutely spectacular ramen. Really great balance of flavors, with everything blending perfectly together. Up there with the best ramen in DC.
Super tasty ramen, great space, and friendly staff!
